page.title: 01Breckland village West Tofts
page.content: Most of this block of land has been aquired by the Ministry of Defence and used for army training purposes. It is commonly and locally known as the "Battle Area". There is no public access to genersl public although a pass can be obtained by people living at West Tofts and not connected with the military. The soil is light and sandy with any stones and flints and small areas of boggy grounds, and is generally uncultivated. There is a fair abundance of wildlife particularly near the mere and waterways. Unrestricted rough grazing by sheep is let to the highest tender (not a local farmer). Human habitation is sparse although on the battle area there remains the ruins of cottages.
